content: the body lay out your two body panels with spine sections touching and mattress stitch them together i suggest pulling the mattress stitch fairly snug and it will not be noticeable fold over your top pieces and mattress stitch from the bottom up to create the armhole stitch 36 36 36 37 37 39 40 together leaving 34 36 40 42 44 46 46 unworked stitches for the arm hole time for a fit test put on your piece to ensure the armhole fits adjust to your comfort hood and front extension hood row 1 attach yarn to right front panel when worn in the 10th stitch from neckline this will be a ch1 space working up the right panel across the neck line & down the left panel *single_crochet in ch1 space ch1 sk1* repeat ** around to the 9th st on left front panel single_crochet in 10th st please note when working across neckline you re working into the end of the spine section row single_crochet will be worked into the row that end in a single_crochet and ch1 sk1 will be worked over the ch2 row ends row 2 ch2 counts as turning chain and first st turn sk1 *single_crochet in ch1 space ch1 sk1* repeat **around to last st single_crochet in last st row 3 ch1 turn single_crochet in first st *ch1 sk1 single_crochet in ch1space* repeat ** to end repeat row 2 and 3 for a total of 32 row fo leaving a long tail for seaming the top together bring corners of hood together and mattress stitch top of hood together front extension row 1 xs s m 2x & 3x attach yarn to bottom right corner l & xl attach to bottom left corner of front panel this should be a chain space single_crochet in first space *ch1 sk1 single_crochet in next* repeat ** up right panel around hood front & down left panel row 2 ch2 counts as turning chain and first st turn sk1 *single_crochet in ch1 space ch1 sk1* repeat ** till 2 sts remain single_crochet in last 2 st row 3 ch1 turn single_crochet in first st *ch1 sk1 single_crochet in ch1 space* repeat ** around sizes xs & s continue to ribbing other sizes repeat row 2 & 3 till size m & l have 5 row l&xl have 6 row 2x & 3x have 7 row then continue to ribbing ribbing turn your piece so that you re working along the bottom edge ch7 row 1 turn single_crochet in second chain from the hook and next 5 chs slip_stitch into next 2 st of the body row 2 turn skip 2 slip_stitch single_crochet blo in 5 single_crochet single_crochet in last st row 3 ch1 turn single_crochet blo in 6 single_crochet slip_stitch into next 2 body sts repeat row 2 & 3 till you reach the other bottom corner end on a row 2 repeat turn your piece again so that you re working along the front edge
